case_vignette: A 7-year-old girl presents to the emergency department with swelling around her eye. This has happened to her before but has never been this severe. The lesion started a few days ago but has become increasingly red and painful. Physical exam reveals the lesion in Figure A which is tender to palpation. Her cranial nerves are intact and there is no pain with extraocular movements.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My eye is really swollen, and it's more red and painful than it's ever been before.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your eye?
No, I haven't had any injuries to my eye.
Have you noticed any discharge or crusting on the eyelid?
No, there's no discharge or crusting on my eyelid.
Have you had any allergies or infections in the past?
This swelling has happened before, but I don't know if it's because of allergies or infections.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I haven't been taking any medications.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision or any other symptoms?
My vision is fine, and there's no pain when I move my eyes around.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin or any other parts of your body?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my skin or any other parts of my body.
Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or weight?
No, my appetite and weight have been normal.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
No, my sleep and energy levels have been the same as usual.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or any other psychological symptoms?
No, my mood has been normal and I haven't had any other psychological symptoms.
Have you noticed any changes in your family history of eye conditions?
I can't answer that; I'm just a kid and don't know much about my family's eye history.
Final Diagnosis: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
